title: Flying over Arnhem in 1926 in color! [AI enhanced & colorized]

sources.title: Flying over Arnhem in 1926 in color! [AI enhanced & colorized]
sources.description: A wonderful flight with a Fokker F.VII aircraft, registration number H-NACT over the city of Arnhem in The Netherlands in 1926. This film has been restored and colorized with Artificial Intelligence software. Arnhem is well known the World-over for in particular its role during WWII. Many viewers will have seen the famous movie "A Bridge Too Far" with among other Sean Connery and many other stars. The river can be seen in this film, as it was nearly 20 years before the end of WWII. This original N-HACT was destroyed at Schiphol airport during the German assult at the beginning of WWII. After the war a similar aircraft was bought (from Sweden?) and re-named N-HACT. It can still be seen in the Aviodome museum (to be confirmed). At the beginning the pilot can be seen smoking a cigarette before getting his aircraft ready for the flight. Subsequently the film shows the old town and views of the bridges over the river Rhine. For more details, check out this time line: Draft Timeline (please help to complete this!): 00:00 The Fokker H-NACT at old Schiphol (?) airport. 00:12 Just after take off 00:14 Large mansion, top left, "Huis Zypendaal" 00:22 Staringplein 00:30 Van Slichtenhorststraat and Onze Lieve Vrouwekerk 00:33 Velperplein / Stille Hoek area (with the old V&D store) 00:36 Crossing the railway line 00:42 Park at Velperplein; top left is front of Musis Sacrum concert hall 00:45 Vijfsprong is land van de markt 00:55 Church: Eusebiuskerk 01:02 Grote Markt 01:12 Church: Sint Walburgiskerk 01:14 Lauwersgracht (the entrance to the Rhine bridge was constructed here 10 years later) 01:22 Eusebiussingel, Velperplein and Musispark 01:32 Musis Sacrum concert hall, built in 1847 01:39 Jansbinnensingel and Jansbuitensingel 01:42 Jans Singel (now filled-in); White building is now Hotel Molendal 01:45 Zijpse poort, under the railtrack on to the Sonsbeek Park 01:48 Area Jacob Cremerstraat (top left is the Zypsepoort) and Sonsbeek Park 01:51 Area St. Marten and Apeldoornseweg 01:57 The river Rhine; Meijnerswijk across the river 02:00 Old Rhine harbor 02:07 Meinerswijk stone factory 02:16 Domed Prison (Koepelgevangenis), built in 1886 02:26 River Rhine (Nederrijn); Hulkesteinseweg 02:32 Location (?) 02:42 Town of Velp and surroundings with OLV Visitatiekerk 02:45 Velp with the OLV Visitatiekerk; Park is Villapark Overbeek 02:51 Velp Vijverlaan 03:07 Evertsenlaan and Prins Hendriklaan, corner Vijverlaan Music: Trevor Kowalski Source B&W footage: Beeld en Geluid (Dutch video archive)
